The claim made by Jessica Morse: the Democratic challenger, is that Congressman Tom McClintock has authored only three laws since he's been in office, two of which were to rename post offices.
The claim was made in a tweet by Morse: which linked to an article written by Eric Johnson, the editor of the Sacramento News & Review, titled "Defeat Trump's local ally."
Fact: checking websites Govtrack.us and Congress.gov show that McClintock has actually authored four bills that were signed into law, contradicting Morse's claim.
While it is true that two of McClintock: s bills were indeed to rename post offices, the effectiveness of a lawmaker should not be solely judged based on the number of bills they have authored.
